info.description:
REST API for querying information about CockroachDB cluster health, nodes, ranges,
sessions, and other meta information. For additional details, see cockroachlabs.com/docs/stable/cluster-api.
info.title: CockroachDB v2 API

get.description: List all databases on this cluster.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation token for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Name of the database being looked up.
parameters.name: database

get.description:
Retrieve grants on a database. Grants are the privileges granted to users
on this database.

parameters.description: Name of the database being looked up.
parameters.name: database

parameters.description: Maximum number of grants to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation token for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: offset

get.description:
List names of all tables in the database. The names of all responses will
be schema-qualified.

parameters.description: Name of the database being looked up.
parameters.name: database

parameters.description: Maximum number of tables to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation token for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Name of the database being looked up.
parameters.name: database

parameters.description: Name of table being looked up. Table may be schema-qualified (schema.table) and each name component that contains sql unsafe characters such as . or uppercase letters must be surrounded in double quotes like "Naughty schema".table.
parameters.name: table

get.description: List the latest event log entries, in descending order.

parameters.description: Type of events to filter for (e.g., "create_table"). Only one event type can be specified at a time.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Filter for events with this targetID. Only one targetID can be specified at a time.
parameters.name: targetID

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation token for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: offset

get.description:
Check for node health. If `ready` is true, also check
if this node is fully operational and ready to accept SQL connections.
Otherwise, this endpoint always returns a successful response (if the API
server is up).

parameters.description: If true, check whether this node is ready to accept SQL connections. If false, this endpoint always returns success, unless the API server itself is down.
parameters.name: ready

post.description:
Create an API session for use with API endpoints that require
authentication.

parameters.description: Credentials for login.
parameters.name: credentials

400.description: Bad request, if required parameters absent.

401.description: Unauthorized, if credentials do not match.

post.description: Log out, invalidating the API session token.

400.description: Bad request, returned if API session token is not present or invalid.

get.description:
List all nodes on this cluster.

Client must be logged in as a user with admin privileges.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation offset for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: offset

get.description:
List information about ranges on a specified node. If a list of range IDs
is specified, only information about those ranges is returned.

Client must be logged-in as a user with admin privileges.

parameters.description: ID of node to query, or `local` for local node.
parameters.name: node_id

parameters.description: IDs of ranges to return information for. All ranges returned if unspecified.
parameters.name: ranges

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation offset for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: offset

get.description:
List information about hot ranges. If a list of range IDs
is specified, only information about those ranges is returned.

Client must be logged in as a user with admin privileges.

parameters.description: ID of node to query, or `local` for local node. If unspecified, all nodes are queried.
parameters.name: node_id

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation token for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: start

get.description:
Retrieve more information about a specific range.

Client must be logged in as a user with admin privileges.

List all sessions on this cluster. If a username is provided, only
sessions from that user are returned.

Client must be logged in as a user with admin privileges.

parameters.description: Username of user to return sessions for; if unspecified, sessions from all users are returned.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation token for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: start

get.description: List SQL users on this cluster.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Continuation token for results after a past limited run.
parameters.name: offset

ActiveQuery.title: A query in flight on a session.

id.description: ID of the query (uint128 presented as a hexadecimal string).

is_distributed.description: True if this query is distributed.

progress.description:
An estimate of the fraction of this query that has been
processed.

sql.description: SQL query string specified by the user.

sql_no_constants.description: The SQL statement fingerprint, compatible with StatementStatisticsKey.

ActiveQuery_Phase.title: Phase of execution: `0` for PREPARING, `1` for EXECUTING. For more information see the doc "SHOW QUERIES".

Attributes.description:
Attributes specifies a list of arbitrary strings describing
node topology, store type, and machine capabilities.

ClockTimestamp.description:
The statically typed version of a Timestamp with its
Synthetic flag set to false.
ClockTimestamp.title:
A timestamp with the added capability of being able to
update a peer's hybrid logical clock (HLC). It possesses this capability because the clock
timestamp itself is guaranteed to have come from an HLC clock somewhere in
the system. As such, a clock timestamp is a promise that some node in the
system has a clock with a reading equal to or above its value.

Constraint.title: Constrains the stores that a replica can be stored on.

key.description: Only set if this is a constraint on locality.

ConstraintsConjunction.description:
A set of constraints that need to be satisfied
together by a replica (i.e., by the replica's store).

constraints.description:
The set of attributes and/or localities that need to be satisfied by the
store.

num_replicas.description:
The number of replicas that should abide by the constraints below. If left
unspecified (i.e., set to 0), the constraints will apply to all replicas of
the range.
As of v2.0, only REQUIRED constraints are allowed when num_replicas is
set to a non-zero value.

user.description: User that this grant applies to.

DatabasesResponse.title: DatabasesResponse contains a list of databases.

EventsResponse.description:
A set of event log entries. This is always limited
to the latest N entries (N is enforced in the associated endpoint).

info.description:
Detailed information for the event. The contents vary
depending on the event.

timestamp.description: The time at which the event occurred.

unique_id.description: A unique identifier for this event.

GCPolicy.title:
GCPolicy defines garbage collection policies which apply to MVCC
values within a zone.

ttl_seconds.description:
TTLSeconds specifies the maximum age of a value before it's
garbage collected. Only older versions of values are garbage
collected. Specifying <= 0 mean older versions are never GC'd.

Key.description:
Key is a custom type for a byte string in proto
messages which refer to Cockroach keys.

Lease.description:
Lease contains information about range leases including the
expiration and lease holder.

epoch.description:
The epoch of the lease holder's node liveness entry. If this value is
non-zero, the expiration field is ignored.

LeaseAcquisitionType.description:
The type of lease acquisition event that
resulted in the current lease.

LeasePreference.description:
A preference about where range leases should be
located.

LeaseSequence.title: A custom type for a lease sequence number.

ListSessionsError.title: An error wrapper object for ListSessionsResponse.

ListSessionsResponse.title: Response object for ListSessions and ListLocalSessions.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during fan-out calls to other nodes.

sessions.description: A list of sessions on this node or cluster.

Locality.description:
An ordered set of key value Tiers that describe a node's
location. The tier keys should be the same across all nodes.

NodeID.description:
A custom type for a cockroach node ID. (not a raft node ID)
0 is not a valid NodeID.

RangeProblems.title: Describes issues reported by a range. For internal use only.

quiescent_equals_ticking.description:
Quiescent ranges do not tick by definition, but we track this in
two different ways and suspect that they're getting out of sync.
If the replica's quiescent flag doesn't agree with the store's
list of replicas that are ticking, warn about it.

raft_log_too_large.description: When the raft log is too large, it can be a symptom of other issues.

RangeStatistics.description:
Describes statistics reported by a range. For internal use
only.

queries_per_second.description:
Queries per second served by this range.

Note that queries per second will only be known by the leaseholder.
All other replicas will report it as 0.

writes_per_second.description: Writes per second served by this range.

ReplicaDescriptor.description:
Describes a replica location by node ID
(corresponds to a host:port via lookup on gossip network) and store
ID (identifies the device).

ReplicaID.title: A custom type for a range replica ID.

ReplicaType.description:
All VOTER* types indicate a replica that participates in all raft activities,
including voting for leadership and committing entries. Typically, this
requires a majority of voters to reach a decision. In a joint config, two
separate majorities are required: one from the set of replicas that have
either type VOTER or VOTER_OUTGOING or VOTER_DEMOTING_{LEARNER, NON_VOTER},
as well as that of the set of types VOTER and VOTER_INCOMING . For example,
when type VOTER_FULL is assigned to replicas 1 and 2, while 3 is
VOTER_OUTGOING and 4 is VOTER_INCOMING, then the two sets over which quorums
need to be achieved are {1,2,3} and {1,2,4}. Thus, {1,2} is a quorum of both,
{1,3} is a quorum of the first but not the second, {1,4} is a quorum of the
second but not the first, and {3,4} is a quorum of neither.
ReplicaType.title:
Identifies which raft activities a replica participates in. In
normal operation, VOTER_FULL, NON_VOTER, and LEARNER are the only used
states. However, atomic replication changes require a transition through a
"joint config"; in this joint config, the VOTER_DEMOTING_{LEARNER, NON_VOTER}
and VOTER_INCOMING types are used as well to denote voters which are being
downgraded to learners and newly added by the change, respectively. When
being removed, a demoting voter is turning into a learner, which we prefer
over a direct removal, which was used prior to v20.1 and uses the
VOTER_OUTGOING type instead (see VersionChangeReplicasDemotion for details on
why we're not doing that any more).

active_queries.description: Queries in progress on this session.

alloc_bytes.description: Number of currently allocated bytes in the session memory monitor.

application_name.description: Application name specified by the client.

client_address.description: Connected client's IP address and port.

id.description: ID of the session (uint128 represented as raw bytes).

last_active_query.description: SQL string of the last query executed on this session.

last_active_query_no_constants.description:
SQL statement fingerprint of the last query executed on this session,
compatible with StatementStatisticsKey.

max_alloc_bytes.description: High water mark of allocated bytes in the session memory monitor.

username.description: Username of the user for this session.

StoreID.title: StoreID is a custom type for a cockroach store ID.

index_id.description:
The ID of the SQL table index that the subzone represents.
Always set.

partition_name.description:
The partition of the SQL table index that the subzone
represents. It is empty when the subzone represents the entire index.

subzone_index.description:
The slice index of the Subzone this span belongs to in the
parent ZoneConfig's subzones field.

TableDetailsResponse.description:
Grants, column names, and indexes for
a table.

configure_zone_statement.description:
The output of "SHOW ZONE CONFIGURATION FOR TABLE"
for this table. It is a SQL statement that would re-configure the table's current
zone if executed.

descriptor_id.description:
An identifier used to uniquely identify this table.
It can be used to find events pertaining to this table by filtering on
the `target_id` field of events.

range_count.description:
The size of the table in ranges. This provides a rough
estimate of the storage requirements for the table.

default_value.description: The default value of this column.

generation_expression.description: The generator expression if the column is computed.

nullable.description: Whether this column can contain NULL.

type.description: the SQL type (e.g., INT, STRING) of this column.

TableDetailsResponse_Grant.title: Grant is an entry from SHOW GRANTS.

user.description: User that this grant applies to.

column.description: The column that this index indexes.

direction.description: Direction of the response parameters. Either "ASC" (ascending) or "DESC" (descending).

implicit.description: An internal variable that is passed.

seq.description: An internal variable that is passed.

storing.description: An internal variable that is passed.

unique.description: Whether this a unique index (i.e., CREATE UNIQUE INDEX).

Tier.title: Tier represents one level of the locality hierarchy.

key.description: Key is the name of tier and should match all other nodes.

value.description: Value is node specific value corresponding to the key.

Timestamp.title: Timestamp represents a state of the hybrid logical clock.

logical.description:
The logical component captures causality for events whose wall times
are equal. It is effectively bounded by (maximum clock skew)/(minimal
ns between events) and nearly impossible to overflow.

It is not safe to mutate this field directly. Instead, use one of the
methods on Timestamp, which ensure that the synthetic flag is updated
appropriately.

synthetic.description:
Indicates that the Timestamp did not come from an HLC clock somewhere
in the system and, therefore, does not have the ability to update a
peer's HLC clock. If set to true, the "synthetic timestamp" may be
arbitrarily disconnected from real time.

The flag serves as the dynamically typed version of a ClockTimestamp
(but inverted). Only Timestamps with this flag set to false can be
downcast to a ClockTimestamp successfully (see TryToClockTimestamp).

Synthetic timestamps with this flag set to true are central to
non-blocking transactions, which write "into the future". Setting the
flag to true is also used to disconnect some committed MVCC versions
from observed timestamps by indicating that those versions were moved
from the timestamp at which they were originally written. Committed
MVCC versions with synthetic timestamps require observing the full
uncertainty interval, whereas readings off the leaseholders's clock
can tighten the uncertainty interval that is applied to MVCC versions
with clock timestamp.

This flag does not affect the sort order of Timestamps. However, it
is considered when performing structural equality checks (e.g., using
the == operator). Consider use of the EqOrdering method when testing
for equality.

wall_time.description:
Holds a wall time, typically a unix epoch time expressed in
nanoseconds.

It is not safe to mutate this field directly. Instead, use one of the
methods on Timestamp, which ensure that the synthetic flag is updated
appropriately.

TxnInfo.title: Represents an in-flight user transaction on a session. This is for internal Cockroach Labs use.

alloc_bytes.description: Number of currently allocated bytes in the transaction memory monitor.

deadline.description: The deadline by which the transaction must be committed.

implicit.description: Implicit is true if this transaction was an implicit SQL transaction.

max_alloc_bytes.description: High water mark of allocated bytes in the txn memory monitor.

num_auto_retries.description:
The number of times that this transaction was automatically
retried by the SQL executor.

num_retries.description: The number of times that this transaction was retried.

num_statements_executed.description:
The number of statements that were executed so
far on this transaction.

start.description: The start timestamp of the transaction.

txn_description.description:
A text description of the underlying kv.Txn, intended
for troubleshooting purposes.

UUID.title: An array type to represent the value of a UUID, as defined in RFC-4122.

network_field.description: Type of network (e.g., TCP, TCP4, TCP6).

UsersResponse.title: UsersResponse returns a list of users.

users.description: A list of users for the cluster.

internal.description:
The internal version is used to introduce migrations during the development
cycle. They are subversions that are never the end versions of a release,
i.e., users of stable, public release will only use binaries with the
internal version set to 0.

patch.description: Note that patch is a placeholder and will always be zero.

ZoneConfig.title: ZoneConfig holds configuration that applies to one or more ranges.

constraints.description:
Constrains which stores the replicas can be stored on. The
order in which the constraints are stored is arbitrary and may change.
https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/blob/master/docs/RFCS/20160706_expressive_zone_config.md#constraint-system

global_reads.description:
Whether transactions operating over the range(s)
should be configured to provide non-blocking behavior, meaning that reads
can be served consistently from all replicas and do not block on writes. In
exchange, writes get pushed into the future and must wait on commit to
ensure linearizability. For more, see:
https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/blob/master/docs/RFCS/20200811_non_blocking_txns.md

inherited_constraints.description:
Whether the value in the Constraints field was
inherited from the zone's parent or specified explicitly by the user.

NB: We need this extra field because the non-nullable nature of
`constraints` means that there is no other way to disambiguate between an
unset `constraints` attribute and an empty one.

inherited_lease_preferences.description:
Whether the value in the LeasePreferences field
was inherited from the zone's parent or specified explicitly by the user.

lease_preferences.description:
Information about where the user would prefer for
range leases to be placed. Leases are allowed to be placed elsewhere if
needed, but will follow the provided preference when possible.

More than one lease preference is allowed, but they should be ordered from
most preferred to least preferred. The first preference that an existing
replica of a range matches will take priority.

null_voter_constraints_is_empty.description:
Whether the `VoterConstraints` field
was explicitly set to be empty or if it was inherited from its parent.

NB: This extra field is needed because the non-nullable nature of
`voter_constraints` means that there is no other way to disambiguate
between an unset `voter_constraints` attribute and an empty one.

This flag is not symmetric with `InheritedConstraints` defined above,
and should only be checked when the list of `VoterConstraints` is empty (as
otherwise they are assumed to _not_ be inherited) because we want 21.1 (and
future versions) nodes to correctly interpret zone configs persisted by
pre-21.1 nodes. That is, in absence of explicit modifications, we want 21.1
nodes to interpret that zone configs written by previous versions inherit
`VoterConstraints` from their parent.

num_replicas.description:
The desired number of replicas. This includes voting
and non-voting replicas.

num_voters.description:
The desired number of voter replicas. If unspecified,
there are no non-voting replicas and NumReplicas will represent the number
of voters.

subzone_spans.description:
Each key span in a subzone mapped to the slice index of an entry
in SubzoneConfig. Spans are non-overlapping and sorted by start key to
allow binary searching. SubzoneSpans can be easily derived from a
TableDescriptor, but are denormalized here to make GetZoneConfigForKey
lookups efficient.

subzones.description:
Config overrides for "subzones", each of which represents
either a SQL table index or a partition of a SQL table index. Subzones are
not applicable when the zone does not represent a SQL table (i.e., when the
zone represents a database, a special system range, or is itself a
subzone.)

voter_constraints.description:
Constrains which stores the voting replicas can be stored
on. This field must be "compatible" with the `Constraints` field above, but
not necessarily a subset. The `VoterConstraints` are said to be compatible
with `Constraints` if none of the constraints in `Constraints` contradict
any of the constraints in `VoterConstraints`. In other words, they are
compatible if none of the "prohibitive" constraints in `Constraints` are
"required" constraints in `VoterConstraints`.

ZoneConfigurationLevel.description:
The object level at which the configuration is defined. This is needed
because objects without a specifically indicated Zone Configuration will
inherit the configuration of their "parent".
ZoneConfigurationLevel.title:
ZoneConfigurationLevel indicates, for objects with a Zone Configuration,
the object level at which the configuration is defined. This is needed
because objects without a specifically indicated Zone Configuration will
inherit the configuration of their 'parent'.
Valid levels are unknown (0), cluster (1), database (2), or table (3).

descriptor_id.description:
An identifier used to uniquely identify this database.
It can be used to find events pertaining to this database by filtering on
the `target_id` field of events.

grants.description: Grants are the privileges granted to users on this database.

next.description:
The continuation token, for use in the next paginated call in the `offset`
parameter.

The continuation token, for use in the next paginated call in the `offset`
parameter.

table_names.description:
The names of all tables in this database. Note that
all responses will be schema-qualified (schema.table) and that every schema
or table that contains a "sql unsafe character" such as uppercase letters
or dots will be surrounded with double quotes, such as "Naughty schema".table.

next.description:
The continuation token, for use in the next paginated call in the `offset`
parameter.

The continuation token, for use in the next paginated call in the `offset`
parameter.

Continuation token for the next paginated call. Use as the `start`
parameter.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during fan-out calls to other nodes.

next.description:
The continuation token, for use in the next paginated call in the `start`
parameter.

sessions.description: A list of sessions on this node or cluster.

session.description:
Session string for a valid API session. Specify this in header for any API
requests that require authentication.

next.description: Continuation token for the next limited run. Use in the `offset` parameter.

cluster_name.description: The string name of this cluster, if set.

liveness_status.description:
The status of the node from the perspective of the
liveness subsystem. For internal use only.

metrics.description: Contains the last sampled metrics for this node.

node_id.description: The integer ID of this node.

num_cpus.description: The number of CPUs on this node.

started_at.description:
The time when this node was started, expressed as
nanoseconds since Unix epoch.

total_system_memory.description:
The total amount of available system memory on this
node (or container), in bytes.

updated_at.description:
The time at which the node status record was last updated,
in nanoseconds since Unix epoch.

next.description:
Continuation offset for the next paginated call, if more values are present.
Specify as the `offset` parameter.

rangeDescriptorInfo.description:
Contains a subset of fields from the Cockroach-internal
range descriptor that are safe to be returned from APIs.

end_key.description:
The resolved Cockroach-internal key that denotes the end of
this range.

queries_per_second.description:
The number of queries per second this range is
serving. Only set for hot ranges.

range_id.description: The integer ID of this range.

start_key.description:
The resolved Cockroach-internal key that denotes the start of
this range.

store_id.description:
The ID of the store this hot range is on. Only set for hot
ranges.

error_message.description:
Any error retrieved from the internal range info. For
internal use only.

source_node_id.description:
The ID of the node where this range info was retrieved
from.

source_store_id.description:
The ID of the store on the node where this range info was
retrieved from.

next.description:
The continuation token, for use in the next paginated call in the `offset`
parameter.

users.description: A list of users for the CockroachDB cluster.

api_session.description: Token for logged-in REST session. Use `/login/` to log in and get a session token. For additional information, see cockroachlabs.com/docs/stable/cluster-api.
api_session.name: X-Cockroach-API-Session
